subject: Cybersecurity
title: Adrian Lamo: The Homeless Hacker
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Adrian Lamo: The Homeless Hacker.

hook.text: He hacked the New York Times, Yahoo, and Microsoft â€” from public libraries and coffee shops.

buildup.text: Adrian Lamo was homeless but brilliant. He found vulnerabilities in major companies using just a web browser.

discovery.text: He would break in, notify the company about the flaw, then move on. He saw himself as a helper.

twist.text: Lamo later turned in Chelsea Manning to the FBI, becoming one of hacking's most controversial figures.

climax.text: His story shows the blurred line between helpful disclosure and betrayal in hacker culture.

punchline.text: The homeless hacker became hacking's greatest traitor.

quiz.question: Why was Adrian Lamo controversial in hacker culture?
